description: You assume that, with the students—particularly the females who might well hold exception of military rank, females hold all true positions of power in the next generation. Others join the soldiers of a authority. When addressing a mixed group of nobles, priests, powerful house or the priestesses of Lolth, working their way or similar powerful individuals, you instinctively direct your up in the ranks. At the very least, these positions grant them words and attention to any females present, and you are always some measure of authority, and if they are fortunate enough startled when a social or political leader turns out to be male. to be offi cers during wartime (or devious enough to start a You normally assume that any military force is, if not indepen- well-timed war), that authority can grow to rival that of some dent, loyal to a church or a bloodline; you’re certainly aware matriarchs. And of course, some drow males attempt to seduce that other cultures have armies devoted to cities or nations, powerful females, using lust—and even the rare emotion of but it still strikes you as odd when you encounter it. love—to infl uence drow leaders behind the scenes. 95726720_Ch01.indd 12 2/22/07 3:01:28 PM 13 THE DROW ALL ABOUT CHAPTER 1 In the lower echelons of drow society, away from the movers Long-Term Planning and shakers, males and females hold similar roles. A member Drow have a shorter average life span than surface elves— of either gender might be a household servant, a shopkeeper, a due primarily to violence, rather than any innate biological soldier, or an artist. The males tend more toward physical labor cause—but they still live far longer than most other humanoid and the females toward skilled crafts—not because females races. Thus, the drow often take a longer view of the world are weaker, but because they often have more opportunities than humans or others. This attitude is manifested in drow to choose their own path than males do—but this is only a plots and schemes, which often take decades or even centu- tendency, not a societal constant. ries to unfold. Whereas this long-term view of life manifests in surface DROW PSYCHOLOGY elves as a seeming unwillingness to make decisions quickly The drow are, to the last, a motivated and driven race. The or to understand urgency, the drow are just as busy and active perception that a drow’s individual worth is determined only as anyone else. Rather than acting slowly by the infl uence she wields over society isn’t simply a cultural because they have more time, drow attitude; it’s a psychological one as well. A drow who holds no prefer to squeeze as much power is a failure in her own eyes, and this more than anything out of their extra years as else drives her behavior. It is thus not merely external pres- possible. Where a sur- sures that cause the drow to plot and scheme; it is an ingrained face elf might take need that borders on instinct. ten times as long For the most part, drow are driven by a trinity of emotions as a human on that exist, to varying degrees, in every member of the race. a given task,
name: Roleplaying Application

description: So far as each drow is concerned, she is a superior specimen of a superior race—or at least she should be. Drow who obtain power do so because they are worthy of it; those who lack authority fi nd themselves resent- fully chafi ng under the rule of others, their pride demanding that they blame everyone else for their fail- ure. A drow never forgets either a victory or a slight.
name: Pride

description: Closely intertwined with their pride is a cur- rent of rage that runs through the entire drow population. They are a primal and instinctive people, quick to lash out at those who offend them. A drow grows wroth at a subordinate who fails or defi es her, a superior for holding the power she herself craves, a foreigner for failing to offer unquestioned submission to the drow, an ally for imagined future betrayal, and even herself for not having accomplished more than she already has. Drow are quick to resort to violence, and revenge is one of their most potent motivators.
name: Anger
